intro: Bejaria guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese bejaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Bejaria guianensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
